CSSCounter-reset.summary: The counter-reset CSS property creates named CSS counters and initializes them to a specific value. It supports creating counters that count up from one to the number of elements, as well as those that count down from the number of elements to one.

CSSCounter-reset.value: The counter-reset property accepts a list of one or more space-separated counter names or the keyword none. For counter names, regular counters use the format <counter-name>, and reversed counters use reversed(<counter-name>), where <counter-name> is a {{cssxref("custom-ident", "<custom-ident>")}} or list-item for the built-in ol counter. Optionally, each counter name can be followed by an <integer> to set its initial value.
